subgoal: Gather and prepare ingredients: bacon or guanciale, Pecorino Romano cheese, eggs, spaghetti or pasta, salt, and pepper. Optionally, use Parmigiano Reggiano cheese and garlic.
original_subgoals: Gather the ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta), pecorino romano cheese, free-range organic eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.
Gather ingredients: thick-cut bacon (or pancetta), Pecorino Romano cheese, Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, eggs, spaghetti, kosher salt, and black pepper.

subgoal: Chop or slice the bacon or guanciale into pieces.
original_subgoals: Cut guanciale (pork cheek) into chunks. Pancetta can be used as an alternative.
Prepare the guanciale by removing the skin and slicing it into 1 cm thick pieces, then chop into 0.5 cm chunks.
Slice about half a pound of bacon into thick pieces, approximately three-quarters of an inch.
Chop up some bacon.

subgoal: Cook the bacon or guanciale in a pan until crispy or golden, optionally using olive oil or garlic.
original_subgoals: Heat olive oil in a pan and add the guanciale to start the sauce.
If desired, remove excess fat from the guanciale using a paper towel.
Place a cold pan on medium-high heat and add the guanciale to render the fat. Optionally, add a cracked garlic clove to the pan for flavor.
Once the guanciale is golden, remove the garlic from the pan.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add a tiny bit of olive oil (optional).
Add the bacon to the pan and slowly render out the fat until the bacon is crispy. Reserve some bacon for garnish.
Once the bacon is rendered, turn off the heat and drain most of the fat, leaving about two tablespoons in the pan.
Cook the bacon in a pan and then turn off the heat to let it cool.

subgoal: Boil water, add salt, and cook spaghetti or pasta until al dente, reserving some pasta water.
original_subgoals: Boil water and add salt at a ratio of 10 grams per liter.
Add spaghettoni (or large spaghetti) to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Check the pasta for doneness and drain when ready.
Fill a pot with water, add a tiny amount of salt, and bring it to a boil.
Twist the pasta with two hands and place it into the boiling water to prevent sticking. Cook for 8 minutes.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and add about a tablespoon of kosher salt to four quarts of water.
Cook the spaghetti in the boiling water until just slightly al dente, about 10 minutes.
Boil water, add salt, and cook spaghetti in it.
Reserve some pasta water and drain the spaghetti.

subgoal: Separate egg yolks from egg whites and whisk together with whole eggs, adding grated Pecorino Romano cheese and optionally Parmigiano Reggiano cheese. Add freshly ground black pepper to the mixture.
original_subgoals: In a bowl, beat two egg yolks (for two people) and add grated parmesan or pecorino cheese and abundant pepper.
Crack the eggs into a bowl and add about 20 grams of pecorino romano cheese. Whisk together.
In a bowl, whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
Separate egg yolks from egg whites using the thumb trick or back and forth method.
Grate about three ounces each of Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese using a fine grater.
Gradually whisk the grated cheese into the egg mixture until well combined.
Grate pecorino romano cheese into the egg yolks.
Crack black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sieve to separate the hotter inner part from the milder outer skin.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture to taste.
Add pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture.

subgoal: Add the cooked spaghetti or pasta to the pan with bacon or guanciale and bacon fat or rendered fat.
original_subgoals: Add the cooked pasta to the pan with the guanciale and mix to flavor the pasta.
Turn off the heat under the guanciale pan and add the cooked pasta directly from the pot, along with some pasta water, to the pan.
Add the drained spaghetti to the pan with the bacon fat (heat still off).
Transfer cooked spaghetti directly from the water into the bacon pan.

subgoal: Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot pasta, stirring to coat the pasta and create a creamy sauce, adding reserved pasta water as needed. Allow the pasta to cool slightly before adding the egg mixture to prevent scrambling.
original_subgoals: Allow the pasta to cool slightly before adding the egg mixture to prevent scrambling.
Add the egg mixture to the pasta and stir to create a creamy sauce.
Stir the pasta and guanciale, allowing the water and fat to emulsify into a creamy sauce.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta, tossing to combine and adding more pasta water as needed to achieve a creamy consistency.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti, stirring gently to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs.
Mix the spaghetti with the bacon and add the egg yolk mixture, stirring to combine.
If needed, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce and achieve a creamy consistency.
Add a bit of pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to start melting the cheese.
Add more pasta water to achieve a creamy consistency.

subgoal: Garnish with additional grated cheese, reserved crispy bacon or guanciale pieces, and more black pepper before serving.
original_subgoals: Finish with additional parmesan or pecorino cheese and a touch of pepper for decoration.
Finish the dish with more cracked black pepper and a sprinkle of pecorino romano cheese.
Serve immediately and enjoy with friends or family.
Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated Parmigiano Reggiano and crispy bacon pieces.
Serve immediately and enjoy your homemade Pasta Carbonara.
Finish with additional pepper and grated pecorino or parmesan cheese.
